intro: Ania elmeri, commonly known as the Elmer's ania, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheat. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Ania elmeri is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes.
